abstract: MSN said that it had signed an agreement with BermanBraun, a Los Angeles production company, to develop and maintain an entertainment-focused Web site.
snippet: MSN said that it had signed an agreement with BermanBraun, a Los Angeles production company, to develop and maintain an entertainment-focused Web site.
lead_paragraph: Can two of Hollywood’s most innovative executives help MSN become a player in advertiser-supported entertainment on the Web? MSN, the Microsoft portal, is betting millions of dollars that the answer is yes.

headline.main: MSN Looks to Hollywood for New Site
headline.print_headline: MSN Looks To Hollywood For New Site

abstract: The billionaire investor Carl C. Icahn vowed to remove Jerry Yang, Yahoo’s chief executive, if he succeeds in replacing the company’s board with his own slate of directors.
snippet: The billionaire investor Carl C. Icahn vowed to remove Jerry Yang, Yahoo’s chief executive, if he succeeds in replacing the company’s board with his own slate of directors.
lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO  The investor Carl C. Icahn stepped up the pressure on Yahoo on Tuesday, vowing to remove Jerry Yang, its chief executive, if he succeeds in replacing the company’s board with his own slate of directors.

headline.main: Icahn Wants New Chief for Yahoo
headline.print_headline: Icahn Wants New Chief For Yahoo

byline.original: By Miguel Helft and Andrew Ross Sorkin

abstract: Who knows whether or not Microsoft and Yahoo will ever merge. In the meantime, investment bankers might consider cruising eBay for their next assignment. The online auction site has money in the bank, a unit it may want to sell and a track record of growing through acquisitions.
lead_paragraph: Who knows whether or not Microsoft and Yahoo will ever merge. In the meantime, investment bankers might consider cruising eBay for their next assignment. The online auction site has money in the bank, a unit it may want to sell and a track record of growing through acquisitions.

abstract: Carl Icahn ratchets up his campaign against Yahoo’s directors with withering criticism of their failure to sell the company to Microsoft.
snippet: Carl Icahn ratchets up his campaign against Yahoo’s directors with withering criticism of their failure to sell the company to Microsoft.
lead_paragraph: Carl C. Icahn sharpened his attack on Yahoo with a public letter to the company’s board that says “the only way to salvage Yahoo is to merge with Microsoft.”
